conclusion: Identify the given parameters: Radius of arc AC R, Refractive index n = 2, Square ABCO with center O
Since O is the center of the arc AC, the radius R is the distance from O to C. The arc AC forms a semicircle with radius R.
The angle subtended by the arc AC at the center O is θ. Using the refractive index n = 2, the angle θ can be calculated using the formula: θ = π/2 × R/n
Since the arc AC subtends a right angle at O, the length of the arc AC is given by: Arc length = 2 × R × sin(θ)
Substitute θ = π/2 × R/2 into the arc length formula: Arc length = 2 × R × sin(π/2 × R/2)
Since sin(π/2 × R/2) = 1, the arc length becomes: Arc length = 2 × R × 1 = 2R
Since the arc AC subtends a right angle at O, the length of the arc AC is 2R.
The problem states that some lights cannot directly exit through AB or BC. Therefore, the arc AC must be the arc where these lights cannot exit.
Since the arc AC subtends a right angle at O, the arc AC is the arc where the light cannot exit.
Thus, the length of the arc AC where the light cannot exit is 2R.
The length of the arc where the light cannot exit through AB or BC is 2R.
